title: Improve text contrast and add per-timezone day/night status indicator

requirements.summary: Increase UI text contrast across dashboard and time zone selector so all text remains legible on black background in all states.
acceptanceCriteria: All headings, body text, helper text (including muted/secondary text), button labels, badges, and list items are readable on the black background with no text appearing effectively invisible.
Time zone selector content (labels, timezone IDs, 'Add' badge, and empty-state text) remains legible in both normal and hover states.
No text uses a black (or near-black) color on a black (or near-black) surface, including inside cards, badges, inputs, and buttons.

file_operations.description: Adjust theme CSS variables (especially foreground and muted-foreground) and any relevant global utility styling so secondary/helper text and component text tokens remain clearly readable against the black background throughout the app. (Uses shadcn-ui theming via CSS variables; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Audit and update any dashboard-specific text color classes that could reduce contrast (e.g., muted text, icons, and empty-state content) to ensure readable foreground colors on black/chroma surfaces in both default and interactive states. (Uses shadcn-ui components like Button/Card; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Ensure time zone selector list items, timezone ID helper text, the 'Add' badge, and empty-state messaging keep sufficient contrast in normal and hover states (including hover background changes). Prefer explicit text-* token classes aligned with theme variables where needed. (Uses shadcn-ui Input/Badge/ScrollArea/Button; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Verify and adjust card text styling (title, UTC offset badge, time/date, remove button hover state) so no text becomes near-black on dark surfaces; align with updated theme tokens for consistent readability. (Uses shadcn-ui Card/Badge/Button; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

requirements.summary: Compute and display a per-card Day/Night status based on the card’s IANA time zone and show a color-changing ✦ indicator that updates automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: Each TimeZoneClockCard displays a clear status label in English: "Day" or "Night".
Each TimeZoneClockCard displays a ✦ symbol alongside the status.
The ✦ symbol is yellow when status is Day and blue when status is Night.
The day/night status updates automatically as time advances (without requiring a page refresh) and is calculated per-card using that card’s IANA time zone.
The status label and ✦ remain clearly visible against the app’s black/chroma theme.

file_operations.description: Add day/night computation using the passed `now` and the card’s IANA time zone (via Intl formatting to get local hour), define a simple threshold-based rule (non-sunrise/sunset) to label Day vs Night, and render a status row that includes a ✦ symbol colored yellow for Day and blue for Night; ensure the status remains high-contrast on the black theme and updates as `now` updates. (Uses shadcn-ui Card layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)
